task.title: Deleting an SNMP trap subscriber by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can delete SNMP trap subscribers by using the delete command on the command line.

context.p: You can delete an SNMP trap subscriber by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to delete an SNMP trap subscriber, see .

step.cmd: To delete an SNMP trap subscriber, enter the following command:

info.note: The command must be capitalized as shown, and must use the double quotation marks as shown.
info.p:
Where:
host Specifies the host name or IP address that is being used by the SNMP trap subscriber that you want to delete.

example.p: The following example shows deleting an SNMP trap subscriber that is using IP address 192.168.56.1: delete SNMPTrapSubscriber "Host=192.168.56.1" The requested configuration change has completed successfully.
